image.altText: Jeremy Rockliff appears to be in thought, surrounded by his colleagues.

props.synopsis: Tasmanian Premier Jeremy Rockliff's leadership hangs by a thread, with the Greens' decision about whether to support a no-confidence motion set to determine whether or not he stays in the top job.

title.children: Rockliff future hanging on Greens decision on no-confidence motion

image.altText: A low resolution photo of a middle aged man with glasses wearing a black hat.

props.synopsis: A man, who's body was found in an industrial-sized bin at the rear of a business in Hobart, has been named by Tasmania Police.

title.children: Police release name of man found dead in bin in Hobart

image.altText: A subdivision under construction in southern Tasmania

props.synopsis: Developers in Tasmania can apply for a rebate to offset some of the costs associated with subdivisions. It's part of a program aimed at fast-tracking lots for "affordable" sales but, after 10 months not one affordable lot has been sold.

title.children: Incentive for Tasmanian developers to sell land at 'affordable' prices so far fails to deliver

image.altText: Dead pink fish and pink chunks floating in an open ocean fish pen.

props.synopsis: The EPA report says samples of wild fish — all blue mackerel — taken near Huon fish pens tested above the reporting threshold, with one sample site showing a result 12 times higher than the maximum antibiotic threshold for commercially sold salmon.

title.children: Salmon company Huon used more than tonne of antibiotics in a fortnight, report finds

image.altText: a long slver fish washed up on a beach

props.synopsis: When Sybil Robertson took a stroll at Ocean Beach on Monday, she was unaware she was about to join the small and exclusive club of people who have found an oarfish.

title.children: Dog walker finds elusive 'doomsday' fish on remote Tasmanian beach

image.altText: Jacquie Lambie speaks to media.

props.synopsis: In her first interview since the election, Jacqui Lambie has told of her flagging health, her surprise at Labor's electoral turnaround, and her determination to keep Tasmanian issues on the national stage.

title.children: Lambie's surprise at Labor's campaign turnaround

image.altText: The rear of an ambulance driving down a wet road at dusk. The headlights of other cars can be seen shining.

props.synopsis: Distraught families say the New South Wales public mental health system abandoned their loved ones when they needed care the most — and doctors warn the crisis is only getting worse.

title.children: 'Days later she was dead': Families devastated by a collapsing mental health system

image.altText: Matthew Miller stands at a State Department podium.

props.synopsis: Matthew Miller, the former top US State Department spokesperson who sparred with journalists when they raised allegations of war crimes, now says Israel has "without a doubt" committed war crimes in Gaza.

title.children: Biden spokesman who defended Israel now says it committed war crimes

image.altText: A crypto ATM is seen on a street with a man walking behind it.

props.synopsis: Australians are losing millions of dollars each year to scams involving cash deposits at cryptocurrency ATMs — machines authorities warn are increasingly being exploited by criminals for money laundering.

title.children: Older Australians losing millions in scams involving crypto ATMs

image.altText: A woman having a cosmetic injectible in her lip.

props.synopsis: The Australian health practitioner regulator introduces sweeping new guidelines for dentists and nurses performing non-surgical cosmetic injectable procedures, in a bid to better protect consumers.

title.children: 'Crystal clear' new rules for nurses, dentists performing cosmetic injectables

image.altText: an aboriginal man wearing a hoodie and bowler hat in a park

props.synopsis: Former Alice Springs Coles worker Gene Hill says it was clear an Aboriginal man who died in police custody at the supermarket last week had a disability and needed extra support.

title.children: Coles staffer says man who died in custody clearly had 'special needs'

image.altText: Keir Starmer speaks at a lectern with a crowd of people behind him

props.synopsis: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer says the "moment has arrived to transform how we defend ourselves" but has not given a date for when UK defence spending will rise to 3 per cent of GDP.

title.children: UK to radically change its defence approach to address Russian threats

image.altText: A logo says 'ASIC'.

props.synopsis: ASIC is suing insurance comparison provider Choosi for allegedly accepting $61 million in commissions to solely advertise services from one insurance company, Hannover.

title.children: ASIC accuses comparison site of promoting single insurer

image.altText: Matildas coach Tom Sermanni stands next to Football Australia executive Heather Garriock, holding a 'Sermanni 150'  jersey.

props.synopsis: From empty fields to sold-out stadiums, former coach Tom Sermanni can barely believe the Matildas' evolution since he first took the reins in 1994.

title.children: Sermanni departs Matildas pinching himself after 'phenomenal' privilege

image.altText: John Lennon and Yoko Ono sit near a piano and guitar in an interior space with visible window frames

props.synopsis: One To One: John & Yoko takes us inside the lives of the famous couple as they agitate for revolution in their new home city of New York.

title.children: New doco might make you rethink John Lennon and Yoko Ono's impact in the 70s

image.altText: A white middle aged man with short hair and a blue suit. He is sitting at a desk reading a report

props.synopsis: A Commonwealth Ombudsman's investigation finds Australia's child support system has been weaponised by financial abuse that is "amplified" by Services Australia.

title.children: Parents 'manipulating' child support system without consequence: report

image.altText: Joanna Pascua

props.synopsis: Joanna Pascua wins the right to Australian workplace protections despite living almost 6,000 kilometres away. Lawyers say she paved the way for legal claims, including class actions, against employers by "exploited" offshore workers.

title.children: Filipino woman changes the game for Australia's 'exploited' offshore workers

image.altText: Cloud plumes coming from a volcano.

props.synopsis: Mount Etna, an active volcano on the east coast of Sicily, erupted on Monday, sending tourists on the mountain running for safety.

title.children: Mount Etna suddenly erupts, sending tourists fleeing for safety

image.altText: A white headstone on a concreted grave glints in the afternoon sun.

props.synopsis: More than a century after his real name was written out of history, a chance encounter and a lucky find at a rubbish tip restore a soldier's true identity and return him to his family.

title.children: WWII soldier buried with wrong name for 80 years identified by pure luck

image.altText: A suspension bridge surrounded by trees.

props.synopsis: Police say a group of 20 youths set upon two teenage males in Shepparton who were hospitalised with suspected machete injuries.

title.children: Two teens suffer suspected machete wounds in fight with 20 youths

image.altText: GettyImages-2217425200

props.synopsis: Max Verstappen stops short of apologising for an incident involving George Russell at the Spanish Grand Prix.

title.children: 'Emotions can run high': Verstappen addresses Russell incident

image.altText: Madeleine McCann

props.synopsis: The disappearance of British toddler Madeleine McCann remains unsolved after 18 years. Now Portuguese and German police have launched fresh searches to find her.

title.children: What police hope a new search for Madeleine McCann uncovers

image.altText: People cross at an intersection in Brisbane CBD in June 2018.

props.synopsis: Minimum and award wages will lift 3.5 per cent from July 1. Australian shares have closed higher. Catch up on the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Minimum wage to rise above inflation, ASX rises — as it happened

image.altText: Grant Stevens in police uniform and hat outside a building with revolving glass door

props.synopsis: SA Police has launched a commissioner's inquiry after a man became unresponsive while being arrested last week in Adelaide's east.

title.children: Inquiry called after man becomes unresponsive during attempted arrest

image.altText: HESTA logo on a wall

props.synopsis: Australia's superannuation pool is worth nearly $4.2 trillion — the funds are undoubtedly extremely adept at taking members' money. But when it comes helping members to access it, they are falling short.

title.children: Is it acceptable to be locked out of your super fund for seven weeks?

image.altText: An older First Nations womans sitting on a camp chair in front of a red rocky hill.

props.synopsis: Many in the remote iron ore mining town of Pannawonica call it the Panna Hill, but Robe River Kuruma people know it as Parlapuni.

title.children: The long story behind WA mining town's landmark hill

image.altText: A group of men and women in conversation as they descend a flight of stairs

props.synopsis: Delegations from the warring nations meet for peace talks in Istanbul, agreeing to exchange more prisoners of war but failing to reach a ceasefire deal.

title.children: Russia and Ukraine agree to prisoner swap but not ceasefire

image.altText: Four men arrested on the front yard of a home in Wetherill Park

props.synopsis: Seven men have been charged by police after a multi-agency taskforce working for almost two years busted a huge drug ring.

title.children: Hundreds of kilos of drugs, millions of illegal cigarettes seized in police bust

image.altText: Jonathan Joss was best known for his role in the animated show King of the Hill.

props.synopsis: The 59-year-old's husband Tristan Kern de Gonzales alleged the couple had been victims of homophobic abuse.

title.children: King of the Hill actor shot dead as husband says they faced homophobic abuse

image.altText: Toutai Kefu speaks with microphones in front of him and a bandage on his arm.

props.synopsis: The boys — aged 15 at the time of the offence — were sentenced to seven and eight years in prison respectively after attacking rugby union great Toutai Kefu and his family at their home.

title.children: Teens who attacked rugby great during home invasion have sentences upheld

image.altText: A illustration shows two plate-shaped galaxies approaching each other.

props.synopsis: A new study challenges predictions our home galaxy the Milky Way will crash into the Andromeda galaxy in 5 billion years.

title.children: Milky Way may crash into another galaxy in 2 billion years. It's not Andromeda

image.altText: Gabby Thomas standing at the start line before a sprint, smiling

props.synopsis: Three-time Olympic track gold medallist Gabby Thomas says she was verbally abused at a meet in Philadelphia last weekend.

title.children: Olympic gold medallist harassed by gambler at track meet

image.altText: A woman in a white shirt is photographed outdoors with soft sunlight and greenery in the background.

props.synopsis: SA fashion entrepreneur Carol Foord turned to alternative treatments before her death. A year on her family is still seeking answers about how her final hours played out.

title.children: An Adelaide fashion icon died after using magic mushrooms. Her family wants answers

image.altText: A man with greying hair and a large bandage over his right ear emotionless in a police mugshot

props.synopsis: FBI documents allege Mohamed Sabry Soliman used a makeshift flamethrower and threw Molotov cocktails at a pro-Israel group in an attack he says he planned for more than a year.

title.children: Colorado terror attack suspect charged with hate crime

image.altText: A young woman and a little girl standing under a tree

props.synopsis: The family of Chantelle McDougall and her daughter Leela appeals for information as they continue to live with the "emotional roller-coaster" of their 2007 disappearance.

title.children: Baffling mystery of cult leader and family who vanished 18 years ago
